compilerArguments.help: Compiler arguments are applied to all compilers, unless explicitly modified in post processing

entry.help: main entry point for your program, across all contexts

out.help: destination for compiled bundle. If there are multiple, the destination of specific bundles will be decided by the --combinator

watch.help: monitor source files for changes and recompile.

chunkFilename.help: If provided, enables code splitting with webpack.require. Examples patterns include  '[id].chunk.js', '[name].chunk.js'

babelPresets.help: add a preset to the babel loader, between es2015 and stage-0

outCombinator.help: string to combine arguments that "define" a compiler (environment, environment)

outPrefix.help: prefix for generated contextual modules. Appended to `out` directory

cartesianArguments.help: Cartesian arguments are array arguments that generate compilers equal to the unorderd cartesian product between them

environments.help: an application lifecycle environment {DEVELOPMENT, PRODUCTION, etc} this distribution will run in

contexts.help: a context {NODE, BROWSER, etc} this distribution will run in.

managerArguments.help: Task arguments are arguments that are fed to the task manager

task.help: the task to run. If non is specified, it will be inferred from other arguments.

run.help: Which context to run on compilation, if any

runner.help: Which runner to run the selected compiler with, if any

logLevel.help: VERBOSE will output webpack stats and warnings

compilers.help: List of simple compiler definitions, in case there are little or no shared compiler arguments.

environment.help: an application lifecycle environment {DEVELOPMENT, PRODUCTION, etc} this distribution will run in.

context.help: a context {NODE, BROWSER, etc} this distribution will run in.

presets.help: Presets are functions that apply default or derived arguments at various stages of parsing, loaded from the module given as an argument from the export of the given preset.

compilerPreset.help: Preset for compiler arguments, both simple and cartesian, applied before any other process

managerPreset.help: Preset for manager arguments, applied after compilerPresets are run

argumentPreset.help: combination of managerPreset and compilerPreset, runs after both are completed. If the given module doesn't export an argumentPreset, it's compilerPreset and managerPresets will be used in succession instead.

compilerListPreset.help: Preset for the compiler list, applied after the list has been generated

postPreset.help: Preset applied after all parsing processes have run

preset.help: module from which to import ALL of the potential presets (any missing presets will be identities)
